title: Rising Sun Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: A McCarron / CC BY-SA (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)
images.caption: Autumn colours in the Rising Sun Country Park The trees in the park are mainly Birch, Scots Pine, Alder, Oak and Hawthorn. Their growth has been slow, possibly due to nature of the soil.

images.title: Antonia / Rising Sun Country Park
images.caption: View from the hill over the park

images.title: Christine Westerback / Rising Sun Country Park
images.caption: The slag heap from the Rising Sun Colliery which closed in the 60's. Now a busy country park

images.title: Christine Westerback / Rising Sun Country Park
images.caption: Wooden sculpture at the entrance to walks around Swallow Pond

images.title: Chris Tweedy / Rising Sun Country Park
images.caption: Between Benton and Wallsend, North Tyneside. Named because of its proximity to the now long gone Rising Sun colliery.

images.title: Les Hull / Swallow Pond, Rising Sun Narure Reserve
images.caption: The Swallow Pond at the Rising Sun Nature Reserve. A good spot to look out for wildlife in the park.

description: Explore 400 acres of parkland on this lovely cycle or walk in Newcastle. There is an extensive network of footpaths and bridleways suitable for walkers and cyclists. The park is made up of various habitats including grassland, woodland, ponds, wetlands and a lake designated as a Local Nature Reserve. There is also a bird hide overlooking the Swallow Pond and an excellent Visitors' Centre with a Restaurant and Exhibition Room.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: There's a good on site cafe selling a range of meals and snacks. There's ample seating outside so you can enjoy your meal with a view of the park.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The park is a very nice place to bring your dog for a walk. You're bound to bump into plenty of other dogs with their owners on a fine day. The on site cafe is also dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Just to the south of the park you can pick up the epic Hadrian's Wall Path at Wallsend. The waymarked trail will take you west along the Tyne River to Newcastle and Gateshead. Here you can visit another local country park in the shape of Watergate Forest Park where there's some nice woodland trails and a pretty lake.

display_address: Sunholme Drive, Benton, Wallsend, North Tyneside, Tyne and Wear, North East, England, NE28 9YT, United Kingdom
